activities.name: Explore Asakusa & Senso-ji Temple
activities.description: Immerse yourself in old Tokyo. Visit Senso-ji, Tokyo's oldest temple, and stroll through Nakamise-dori market for traditional snacks and souvenirs.

activities.name: Ueno Park & Tokyo National Museum
activities.description: Enjoy a relaxing afternoon in Ueno Park, home to several museums and a zoo. Visit the Tokyo National Museum to delve deeper into Japanese art and history.

activities.name: Shinjuku Golden Gai or Omoide Yokocho
activities.description: Experience the vibrant nightlife and unique atmosphere of Shinjuku's narrow alleyways, famous for tiny bars and delicious street food.

food_recommendations.dish: Onigiri (rice ball) or a light pastry

activities.name: Tsukiji Outer Market Exploration
activities.description: Wander through the bustling Tsukiji Outer Market, sampling fresh seafood, street food, and experiencing the lively atmosphere.

activities.name: Shibuya Crossing & Harajuku
activities.description: Witness the iconic Shibuya Crossing, visit the Hachiko statue, then head to Harajuku for Meiji Jingu Shrine's serene beauty and Takeshita Street's quirky fashion and street food.

activities.name: Meiji Jingu Shrine
activities.description: Find peace amidst the urban bustle at this beautiful Shinto shrine dedicated to Emperor Meiji and Empress Shoken. It's a great contrast to the vibrant Harajuku.

food_recommendations.dish: Tamagoyaki (rolled omelet) or Fresh Seafood Skewers

activities.name: Imperial Palace East Garden
activities.description: Explore the beautiful and serene gardens of the former Edo Castle, now part of the Imperial Palace grounds. A peaceful escape in the city center.

activities.name: Ginza Shopping District
activities.description: Stroll through Ginza, Tokyo's upscale shopping district. Enjoy window shopping at luxury boutiques and department stores. Visit a traditional Kabuki-za if interested (exterior viewing free).

activities.name: Tokyo Skytree Observation Deck
activities.description: Ascend to the top of the Tokyo Skytree for breathtaking panoramic views of the city, especially beautiful during sunset.

food_recommendations.dish: Coffee and a Japanese pastry (e.g., Anpan)
Katsu Curry (fried pork cutlet with curry rice)
Hire Katsu Set (pork fillet cutlet set meal)

accommodation_suggestions.location: Ueno (close to Ueno Park and Ueno Station)

to_destination.tips: The $1500 USD budget is for in-Tokyo expenses (accommodation, food, activities, local transport) and does not include international flights to/from Japan. For airport transfer, from Narita (NRT) use Narita Express (N'EX) or Keisei Skyliner. From Haneda (HND) use Keikyu Line or Tokyo Monorail. Purchase tickets upon arrival or in advance.
Fastest way from Narita Airport to major Tokyo stations like Shinjuku, Shibuya, Tokyo Station, Ueno. Consider a round-trip ticket for savings.
Efficient and direct routes from Haneda Airport to central Tokyo (e.g., Shinagawa, Hamamatsucho).

local_transport.tips: Tokyo's public transport is excellent. Purchase a Suica or Pasmo IC card upon arrival for seamless travel on all trains and subways. Top up as needed. Google Maps is highly accurate for navigation.

travel_tips: Purchase a Suica or Pasmo IC card immediately upon arrival for convenient public transport.
Carry some cash (Yen) as many smaller shops and restaurants, especially in traditional areas, may not accept credit cards.
Learn a few basic Japanese phrases like 'Arigato' (Thank you) and 'Sumimasen' (Excuse me/Sorry).
Respect local customs: no tipping, remove shoes before entering homes/some restaurants, and avoid eating/drinking while walking in public.
Utilize free Wi-Fi hotspots, but consider a portable Wi-Fi device or local SIM card for constant connectivity.
Wear comfortable walking shoes, as you'll be doing a lot of walking.
